item.title: Goodbye, Signal
item.description: Signal was a refreshing take on privacy. It employed strong end-to-end encryption, was open-source, and was something I could genuinely put my trust in. However, that has changed recently. Signal introduced crypto payments in the latest preview of their app - and it’s more or less just a scam. For starters, they’re using “MobileCoin”, which nobody has ever heard of. But the real issue is that the coin is pre-mined, in other words, every coin has already been created.

item.title: Ubuntu Review
item.description: Around a week ago, I decided to finally bite the bullet & switch to Ubuntu. It was relatively easy for me, I didn’t have many files to transfer (most of my disk space was used by programs), and the Ubuntu installation process is much more user-friendly. I’ve been gradually switching to FOSS services, so using Ubuntu (or pretty much any Linux distro, for that matter) was a no-brainer. I kept using Windows for so long because, for the most part, it worked well.
